fields.headline: Everton v Tottenham: match preview
fields.bodyText: The table does not lie after 10 matches and 16th versus 11th in the Premier League says everything about the underachievement of two teams harbouring far greater ambitions. Everton have won their last two games at Goodison Park in league and cup yet, having suffered another avoidable loss at Brighton last weekend, even if controversial, it feels Marco Silva remains only one bad home defeat away from a full-blown crisis. Tottenham suffered their fifth defeat of the campaign on Merseyside last Sunday but showed enough quality on the counterattack at Liverpool to encourage Mauricio Pochettino. Andy Hunter Sunday 4.30pm Sky Sports Premier League Venue Goodison Park Last season Everton 2 Tottenham 6 Referee Martin Atkinson This season G9 Y28 R0 3.11 cards/game Odds H 9-5 A 13-8 D 17-10 EVERTON Subs from Stekelenburg, Lössl, Sigurdsson, Davies, Schneiderlin, Kean, Baines, Coleman, Holgate, Tosun, Gordon Doubtful Mina (knee) Injured Gbamin (thigh, Jan), Bernard (knee, unknown) Suspended None Discipline Y18 R2 Form LLLLWL Leading scorer Calvert-Lewin 3 TOTTENHAM Subs from Vorm, Whiteman, Foyth, Dier, Wanyama, Skipp, Moura, Oakley-Boothe, Walker-Peters, Lo Celso, Ndombele, Vertonghen, Sessegnon Doubtful Vertonghen (hamstring) Injured Lamela (thigh, 9 Nov), Lloris (elbow, unknown) Suspended Rose (one match) Discipline Y22 R1 Form WLWLDL Leading scorer Kane 6
